040package org.jfree.chart.plot;
041
042import org.jfree.chart.api.RectangleInsets;
043import org.jfree.chart.api.Rotation;
044import org.jfree.chart.api.TableOrder;
045import org.jfree.chart.entity.CategoryItemEntity;
046import org.jfree.chart.entity.EntityCollection;
047import org.jfree.chart.event.PlotChangeEvent;
048import org.jfree.chart.internal.*;
049import org.jfree.chart.labels.CategoryItemLabelGenerator;
050import org.jfree.chart.labels.CategoryToolTipGenerator;
051import org.jfree.chart.labels.StandardCategoryItemLabelGenerator;
052import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItem;
053import org.jfree.chart.legend.LegendItemCollection;
054import org.jfree.chart.urls.CategoryURLGenerator;
055import org.jfree.data.category.CategoryDataset;
056import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetChangeEvent;
057import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetUtils;

059import java.awt.*;
060import java.awt.font.FontRenderContext;
061import java.awt.font.LineMetrics;
062import java.awt.geom.*;

064import java.io.ObjectInputStream;

066import java.io.Serializable;

068import java.util.*;

070/**
071 * A plot that displays data from a {@link CategoryDataset} in the form of a
072 * "spider web".  Multiple series can be plotted on the same axis to allow
073 * easy comparison.  This plot doesn't support negative values at present.
074 */
075public class SpiderWebPlot extends Plot implements Cloneable, Serializable {
076
077    private SpiderWebPlotProduct3 spiderWebPlotProduct3 = new SpiderWebPlotProduct3();
078
079        private SpiderWebPlotProduct2 spiderWebPlotProduct2 = new SpiderWebPlotProduct2();
080
081        private SpiderWebPlotProduct spiderWebPlotProduct = new SpiderWebPlotProduct();
082
083        /** For serialization. */
084    private static final long serialVersionUID = -5376340422031599463L;
085
086    /** The default head radius percent (currently 1%). */
087    public static final double DEFAULT_HEAD = 0.01;
088
089    /** The default axis label gap (currently 10%). */
090    public static final double DEFAULT_AXIS_LABEL_GAP = 0.10;
091
092    /** The default interior gap. */
093    public static final double DEFAULT_INTERIOR_GAP = 0.25;
094
095    /** The maximum interior gap (currently 40%). */
096    public static final double MAX_INTERIOR_GAP = 0.40;
097
098    /** The default starting angle for the radar chart axes. */
099    public static final double DEFAULT_START_ANGLE = 90.0;
100
101    /** The default series label font. */
102    public static final Font DEFAULT_LABEL_FONT = new Font("SansSerif",
103            Font.PLAIN, 10);
104
105    /** The default series label paint. */
106    public static final Paint  DEFAULT_LABEL_PAINT = Color.BLACK;
107
108    /** The default series label background paint. */
109    public static final Paint  DEFAULT_LABEL_BACKGROUND_PAINT
110            = new Color(255, 255, 192);
111
112    /** The default series label outline paint. */
113    public static final Paint  DEFAULT_LABEL_OUTLINE_PAINT = Color.BLACK;
114
115    /** The default series label outline stroke. */
116    public static final Stroke DEFAULT_LABEL_OUTLINE_STROKE
117            = new BasicStroke(0.5f);
118
119    /** The default series label shadow paint. */
120    public static final Paint  DEFAULT_LABEL_SHADOW_PAINT = Color.LIGHT_GRAY;
121
122    /**
123     * The default maximum value plotted - forces the plot to evaluate
124     *  the maximum from the data passed in
125     */
126    public static final double DEFAULT_MAX_VALUE = -1.0;
127
128    /** The gap between the labels and the axes as a %age of the radius. */
129    private double axisLabelGap;
130
131    /** The paint used to draw the axis lines. */
132    private transient Paint axisLinePaint;
133
134    /** The stroke used to draw the axis lines. */
135    private transient Stroke axisLineStroke;
136
137    /** The dataset. */
138    private CategoryDataset dataset;
139
140    /** The maximum value we are plotting against on each category axis */
141    private double maxValue;
142
143    /**
144     * The data extract order (BY_ROW or BY_COLUMN). This denotes whether
145     * the data series are stored in rows (in which case the category names are
146     * derived from the column keys) or in columns (in which case the category
147     * names are derived from the row keys).
148     */
149    private TableOrder dataExtractOrder;
150
151    /** The starting angle. */
152    private double startAngle;
153
154    /** The direction for drawing the radar axis and plots. */
155    private Rotation direction;
156
157    /** The legend item shape. */
158    private transient Shape legendItemShape;
159
160    /** The series paint list. */
161    private transient Map<Integer, Paint> seriesPaints;
162
163    /** The default series paint. */
164    private transient Paint defaultSeriesPaint;
165
166    /** The series outline paint list. */
167    private transient Map<Integer, Paint> seriesOutlinePaints;
168
169    /** The default series outline paint. */
170    private transient Paint defaultSeriesOutlinePaint;
171
172    /** The series outline stroke list. */
173    private transient Map<Integer, Stroke> seriesOutlineStrokes;
174
175    /** The default series outline stroke. */
176    private transient Stroke defaultSeriesOutlineStroke;
177
178    /** The color used to draw the category labels. */
179    private transient Paint labelPaint;
180
181    /**
182     * Creates a default plot with no dataset.
183     */
184    public SpiderWebPlot() {
185        this(null);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Creates a new spider web plot with the given dataset, with each row
190     * representing a series.
191     *
192     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
193     */
194    public SpiderWebPlot(CategoryDataset dataset) {
195        this(dataset, TableOrder.BY_ROW);
196    }
197
198    /**
199     * Creates a new spider web plot with the given dataset.
200     *
201     * @param dataset  the dataset.
202     * @param extract  controls how data is extracted ({@link TableOrder#BY_ROW}
203     *                 or {@link TableOrder#BY_COLUMN}).
204     */
205    public SpiderWebPlot(CategoryDataset dataset, TableOrder extract) {
206        super();
207        Args.nullNotPermitted(extract, "extract");
208        this.dataset = dataset;
209        if (dataset != null) {
210            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
211        }
212
213        this.dataExtractOrder = extract;
214        spiderWebPlotProduct.setHeadPercent2(DEFAULT_HEAD);
215        this.axisLabelGap = DEFAULT_AXIS_LABEL_GAP;
216        this.axisLinePaint = Color.BLACK;
217        this.axisLineStroke = new BasicStroke(1.0f);
218
219        spiderWebPlotProduct.setInteriorGap2(DEFAULT_INTERIOR_GAP);
220        this.startAngle = DEFAULT_START_ANGLE;
221        this.direction = Rotation.CLOCKWISE;
222        this.maxValue = DEFAULT_MAX_VALUE;
223
224        this.seriesPaints = new HashMap<>();
225        this.defaultSeriesPaint = null;
226
227        this.seriesOutlinePaints = new HashMap<>();
228        this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint = DEFAULT_OUTLINE_PAINT;
229
230        this.seriesOutlineStrokes = new HashMap<>();
231        this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke = DEFAULT_OUTLINE_STROKE;
232
233        spiderWebPlotProduct3.setLabelFont2(DEFAULT_LABEL_FONT);
234        this.labelPaint = DEFAULT_LABEL_PAINT;
235        spiderWebPlotProduct3.setLabelGenerator2(new StandardCategoryItemLabelGenerator());
236
237        this.legendItemShape = DEFAULT_LEGEND_ITEM_CIRCLE;
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Returns a short string describing the type of plot.
242     *
243     * @return The plot type.
244     */
245    @Override
246    public String getPlotType() {
247        // return localizationResources.getString("Radar_Plot");
248        return ("Spider Web Plot");
249    }
250
251    /**
252     * Returns the dataset.
253     *
254     * @return The dataset (possibly {@code null}).
255     *
256     * @see #setDataset(CategoryDataset)
257     */
258    public CategoryDataset getDataset() {
259        return this.dataset;
260    }
261
262    /**
263     * Sets the dataset used by the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
264     * to all registered listeners.
265     *
266     * @param dataset  the dataset ({@code null} permitted).
267     *
268     * @see #getDataset()
269     */
270    public void setDataset(CategoryDataset dataset) {
271        // if there is an existing dataset, remove the plot from the list of
272        // change listeners...
273        if (this.dataset != null) {
274            this.dataset.removeChangeListener(this);
275        }
276
277        // set the new dataset, and register the chart as a change listener...
278        this.dataset = dataset;
279        if (dataset != null) {
280            dataset.addChangeListener(this);
281        }
282
283        // send a dataset change event to self to trigger plot change event
284        datasetChanged(new DatasetChangeEvent(this, dataset));
285    }
286
287    /**
288     * Method to determine if the web chart is to be filled.
289     *
290     * @return A boolean.
291     *
292     * @see #setWebFilled(boolean)
293     */
294    public boolean isWebFilled() {
295        return this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getWebFilled();
296    }
297
298    /**
299     * Sets the webFilled flag and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
300     * registered listeners.
301     *
302     * @param flag  the flag.
303     *
304     * @see #isWebFilled()
305     */
306    public void setWebFilled(boolean flag) {
307        spiderWebPlotProduct2.setWebFilled(flag, this);
308    }
309
310    /**
311     * Returns the data extract order (by row or by column).
312     *
313     * @return The data extract order (never {@code null}).
314     *
315     * @see #setDataExtractOrder(TableOrder)
316     */
317    public TableOrder getDataExtractOrder() {
318        return this.dataExtractOrder;
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Sets the data extract order (by row or by column) and sends a
323     * {@link PlotChangeEvent}to all registered listeners.
324     *
325     * @param order the order ({@code null} not permitted).
326     *
327     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code order} is
328     *     {@code null}.
329     *
330     * @see #getDataExtractOrder()
331     */
332    public void setDataExtractOrder(TableOrder order) {
333        Args.nullNotPermitted(order, "order");
334        this.dataExtractOrder = order;
335        fireChangeEvent();
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Returns the head percent (the default value is 0.01).
340     *
341     * @return The head percent (always > 0).
342     *
343     * @see #setHeadPercent(double)
344     */
345    public double getHeadPercent() {
346        return this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getHeadPercent();
347    }
348
349    /**
350     * Sets the head percent and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
351     * registered listeners.  Note that 0.10 is 10 percent.
352     *
353     * @param percent  the percent (must be greater than zero).
354     *
355     * @see #getHeadPercent()
356     */
357    public void setHeadPercent(double percent) {
358        spiderWebPlotProduct.setHeadPercent(percent, this);
359    }
360
361    /**
362     * Returns the start angle for the first radar axis.
363     * <BR>
364     * This is measured in degrees starting from 3 o'clock (Java Arc2D default)
365     * and measuring anti-clockwise.
366     *
367     * @return The start angle.
368     *
369     * @see #setStartAngle(double)
370     */
371    public double getStartAngle() {
372        return this.startAngle;
373    }
374
375    /**
376     * Sets the starting angle and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
377     * registered listeners.
378     * <P>
379     * The initial default value is 90 degrees, which corresponds to 12 o'clock.
380     * A value of zero corresponds to 3 o'clock... this is the encoding used by
381     * Java's Arc2D class.
382     *
383     * @param angle  the angle (in degrees).
384     *
385     * @see #getStartAngle()
386     */
387    public void setStartAngle(double angle) {
388        this.startAngle = angle;
389        fireChangeEvent();
390    }
391
392    /**
393     * Returns the maximum value any category axis can take.
394     *
395     * @return The maximum value.
396     *
397     * @see #setMaxValue(double)
398     */
399    public double getMaxValue() {
400        return this.maxValue;
401    }
402
403    /**
404     * Sets the maximum value any category axis can take and sends
405     * a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
406     *
407     * @param value  the maximum value.
408     *
409     * @see #getMaxValue()
410     */
411    public void setMaxValue(double value) {
412        this.maxValue = value;
413        fireChangeEvent();
414    }
415
416    /**
417     * Returns the direction in which the radar axes are drawn
418     * (clockwise or anti-clockwise).
419     *
420     * @return The direction (never {@code null}).
421     *
422     * @see #setDirection(Rotation)
423     */
424    public Rotation getDirection() {
425        return this.direction;
426    }
427
428    /**
429     * Sets the direction in which the radar axes are drawn and sends a
430     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.

432     * @param direction  the direction ({@code null} not permitted).
433     *
434     * @see #getDirection()
435     */
436    public void setDirection(Rotation direction) {
437        Args.nullNotPermitted(direction, "direction");
438        this.direction = direction;
439        fireChangeEvent();
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Returns the interior gap, measured as a percentage of the available
444     * drawing space.
445     *
446     * @return The gap (as a percentage of the available drawing space).
447     *
448     * @see #setInteriorGap(double)
449     */
450    public double getInteriorGap() {
451        return this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getInteriorGap();
452    }
453
454    /**
455     * Sets the interior gap and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all
456     * registered listeners. This controls the space between the edges of the
457     * plot and the plot area itself (the region where the axis labels appear).
458     *
459     * @param percent  the gap (as a percentage of the available drawing space).
460     *
461     * @see #getInteriorGap()
462     */
463    public void setInteriorGap(double percent) {
464        spiderWebPlotProduct.setInteriorGap(percent, this);
465    }
466

471     *

474    public double getAxisLabelGap() {
475        return this.axisLabelGap;
476    }
477
478    /**

486    public void setAxisLabelGap(double gap) {

488        fireChangeEvent();
489    }

491    /**
492     * Returns the paint used to draw the axis lines.
493     *
494     * @return The paint used to draw the axis lines (never {@code null}).

504     * Sets the paint used to draw the axis lines and sends a

542
543    //// SERIES PAINT /////////////////////////
544
545    /**
546     * Returns the paint for the specified series.
547     *
548     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
549     *
550     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
551     *
552     * @see #setSeriesPaint(int, Paint)
553     */
554    public Paint getSeriesPaint(int series) {
555        // look up the paint list
556        Paint result = this.seriesPaints.get(series);
557        if (result == null) {
558            DrawingSupplier supplier = getDrawingSupplier();
559            if (supplier != null) {
560                Paint p = supplier.getNextPaint();
561                this.seriesPaints.put(series, p);
562                result = p;
563            } else {
564                result = this.defaultSeriesPaint;
565            }
566        }
567        return result;
568    }
569
570    /**
571     * Sets the paint used to fill a series of the radar and sends a
572     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
573     *
574     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
575     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} permitted).
576     *
577     * @see #getSeriesPaint(int)
578     */
579    public void setSeriesPaint(int series, Paint paint) {
580        this.seriesPaints.put(series, paint);
581        fireChangeEvent();
582    }
583
584    /**
585     * Returns the default series paint, used when no other paint is
586     * available.
587     *
588     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
589     *
590     * @see #setDefaultSeriesPaint(Paint)
591     */
592    public Paint getDefaultSeriesPaint() {
593      return this.defaultSeriesPaint;
594    }
595
596    /**
597     * Sets the default series paint.
598     *
599     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} not permitted).
600     *
601     * @see #getDefaultSeriesPaint()
602     */
603    public void setDefaultSeriesPaint(Paint paint) {
604        Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
605        this.defaultSeriesPaint = paint;
606        fireChangeEvent();
607    }
608
609    //// SERIES OUTLINE PAINT ////////////////////////////
610
611    /**
612     * Returns the paint for the specified series.
613     *
614     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
615     *
616     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
617     */
618    public Paint getSeriesOutlinePaint(int series) {
619        // otherwise look up the paint list
620        Paint result = this.seriesOutlinePaints.get(series);
621        if (result == null) {
622            result = this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint;
623        }
624        return result;
625    }
626
627    /**
628     * Sets the paint used to fill a series of the radar and sends a
629     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
630     *
631     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
632     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} permitted).
633     */
634    public void setSeriesOutlinePaint(int series, Paint paint) {
635        this.seriesOutlinePaints.put(series, paint);
636        fireChangeEvent();
637    }
638
639    /**
640     * Returns the base series paint. This is used when no other paint is
641     * available.
642     *
643     * @return The paint (never {@code null}).
644     */
645    public Paint getDefaultSeriesOutlinePaint() {
646        return this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint;
647    }
648
649    /**
650     * Sets the base series paint and sends a change event to all registered
651     * listeners.
652     *
653     * @param paint  the paint ({@code null} not permitted).
654     */
655    public void setDefaultSeriesOutlinePaint(Paint paint) {
656        Args.nullNotPermitted(paint, "paint");
657        this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint = paint;
658        fireChangeEvent();
659    }
660
661    //// SERIES OUTLINE STROKE /////////////////////
662
663    /**
664     * Returns the stroke for the specified series.
665     *
666     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
667     *
668     * @return The stroke (never {@code null}).
669     */
670    public Stroke getSeriesOutlineStroke(int series) {
671        Stroke result = this.seriesOutlineStrokes.get(series);
672        if (result == null) {
673            result = this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke;
674        }
675        return result;
676
677    }
678
679    /**
680     * Sets the stroke used to fill a series of the radar and sends a
681     * {@link PlotChangeEvent} to all registered listeners.
682     *
683     * @param series  the series index (zero-based).
684     * @param stroke  the stroke ({@code null} permitted).
685     */
686    public void setSeriesOutlineStroke(int series, Stroke stroke) {
687        this.seriesOutlineStrokes.put(series, stroke);
688        fireChangeEvent();
689    }
690

694     *
695     * @return The stroke (never {@code null}).

697    public Stroke getDefaultSeriesOutlineStroke() {
698        return this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke;

786    /**
787     * Returns the label generator.
788     *
789     * @return The label generator (never {@code null}).
790     *
791     * @see #setLabelGenerator(CategoryItemLabelGenerator)
792     */
793    public CategoryItemLabelGenerator getLabelGenerator() {
794        return this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelGenerator();
795    }

854
855    /**
856     * Returns a collection of legend items for the spider web chart.
857     *
858     * @return The legend items (never {@code null}).
859     */
860    @Override
861    public LegendItemCollection getLegendItems() {
862        LegendItemCollection result = new LegendItemCollection();
863        if (getDataset() == null) {
864            return result;
865        }
866        List keys = null;
867        if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_ROW) {
868            keys = this.dataset.getRowKeys();
869        }
870        else if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_COLUMN) {
871            keys = this.dataset.getColumnKeys();
872        }
873        if (keys == null) {
874            return result;
875        }
876
877        int series = 0;
878        Iterator iterator = keys.iterator();
879        Shape shape = getLegendItemShape();
880        while (iterator.hasNext()) {
881            Comparable key = (Comparable) iterator.next();
882            String label = key.toString();
883            String description = label;
884            Paint paint = getSeriesPaint(series);
885            Paint outlinePaint = getSeriesOutlinePaint(series);
886            Stroke stroke = getSeriesOutlineStroke(series);
887            LegendItem item = new LegendItem(label, description,
888                    null, null, shape, paint, stroke, outlinePaint);
889            item.setDataset(getDataset());
890            item.setSeriesKey(key);
891            item.setSeriesIndex(series);
892            result.add(item);
893            series++;
894        }
895        return result;
896    }
897
898    /**
899     * Returns a cartesian point from a polar angle, length and bounding box
900     *
901     * @param bounds  the area inside which the point needs to be.
902     * @param angle  the polar angle, in degrees.
903     * @param length  the relative length. Given in percent of maximum extend.
904     *
905     * @return The cartesian point.
906     */
907    protected Point2D getWebPoint(Rectangle2D bounds,
908                                  double angle, double length) {
909
910        double angrad = Math.toRadians(angle);
911        double x = Math.cos(angrad) * length * bounds.getWidth() / 2;
912        double y = -Math.sin(angrad) * length * bounds.getHeight() / 2;
913
914        return new Point2D.Double(bounds.getX() + x + bounds.getWidth() / 2,
915                bounds.getY() + y + bounds.getHeight() / 2);
916    }
917
918    /**
919     * Draws the plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
920     * printer).
921     *
922     * @param g2  the graphics device.
923     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
924     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
925     * @param parentState  the state from the parent plot, if there is one.
926     * @param info  collects info about the drawing.
927     */
928    @Override
929    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
930            PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
931
932        // adjust for insets...
933        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
934        insets.trim(area);
935
936        if (info != null) {
937            info.setPlotArea(area);
938            info.setDataArea(area);
939        }
940
941        drawBackground(g2, area);
942        drawOutline(g2, area);
943
944        Shape savedClip = g2.getClip();
945
946        g2.clip(area);
947        Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
948        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
949                getForegroundAlpha()));
950
951        if (!DatasetUtils.isEmptyOrNull(this.dataset)) {
952            int seriesCount, catCount;
953
954            if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_ROW) {
955                seriesCount = this.dataset.getRowCount();
956                catCount = this.dataset.getColumnCount();
957            }
958            else {
959                seriesCount = this.dataset.getColumnCount();
960                catCount = this.dataset.getRowCount();
961            }
962
963            // ensure we have a maximum value to use on the axes
964            if (this.maxValue == DEFAULT_MAX_VALUE) {
965                calculateMaxValue(seriesCount, catCount);
966            }
967
968            // Next, setup the plot area
969
970            // adjust the plot area by the interior spacing value
971
972            double gapHorizontal = area.getWidth() * getInteriorGap();
973            double gapVertical = area.getHeight() * getInteriorGap();
974
975            double X = area.getX() + gapHorizontal / 2;
976            double Y = area.getY() + gapVertical / 2;
977            double W = area.getWidth() - gapHorizontal;
978            double H = area.getHeight() - gapVertical;
979
980            double headW = area.getWidth() * this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getHeadPercent();
981            double headH = area.getHeight() * this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getHeadPercent();
982
983            // make the chart area a square
984            double min = Math.min(W, H) / 2;
985            X = (X + X + W) / 2 - min;
986            Y = (Y + Y + H) / 2 - min;
987            W = 2 * min;
988            H = 2 * min;
989
990            Point2D  centre = new Point2D.Double(X + W / 2, Y + H / 2);
991            Rectangle2D radarArea = new Rectangle2D.Double(X, Y, W, H);
992
993            // draw the axis and category label
994            for (int cat = 0; cat < catCount; cat++) {
995                double angle = getStartAngle()
996                        + (getDirection().getFactor() * cat * 360 / catCount);
997
998                Point2D endPoint = getWebPoint(radarArea, angle, 1);
999                                                     // 1 = end of axis
1000                Line2D  line = new Line2D.Double(centre, endPoint);
1001                g2.setPaint(this.axisLinePaint);
1002                g2.setStroke(this.axisLineStroke);
1003                g2.draw(line);
1004                drawLabel(g2, radarArea, 0.0, cat, angle, 360.0 / catCount);
1005            }
1006
1007            // Now actually plot each of the series polygons..
1008            for (int series = 0; series < seriesCount; series++) {
1009                drawRadarPoly(g2, radarArea, centre, info, series, catCount,
1010                        headH, headW);
1011            }
1012        } else {
1013            drawNoDataMessage(g2, area);
1014        }
1015        g2.setClip(savedClip);
1016        g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
1017        drawOutline(g2, area);
1018    }
1019
1020    /**
1021     * loop through each of the series to get the maximum value
1022     * on each category axis
1023     *
1024     * @param seriesCount  the number of series
1025     * @param catCount  the number of categories
1026     */
1027    private void calculateMaxValue(int seriesCount, int catCount) {
1028        double v;
1029        Number nV;
1030
1031        for (int seriesIndex = 0; seriesIndex < seriesCount; seriesIndex++) {
1032            for (int catIndex = 0; catIndex < catCount; catIndex++) {
1033                nV = getPlotValue(seriesIndex, catIndex);
1034                if (nV != null) {
1035                    v = nV.doubleValue();
1036                    if (v > this.maxValue) {
1037                        this.maxValue = v;
1038                    }
1039                }
1040            }
1041        }
1042    }
1043
1044    /**
1045     * Draws a radar plot polygon.
1046     *
1047     * @param g2 the graphics device.
1048     * @param plotArea the area we are plotting in (already adjusted).
1049     * @param centre the centre point of the radar axes
1050     * @param info chart rendering info.
1051     * @param series the series within the dataset we are plotting
1052     * @param catCount the number of categories per radar plot
1053     * @param headH the data point height
1054     * @param headW the data point width
1055     */
1056    protected void drawRadarPoly(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D plotArea,
1057            Point2D centre, PlotRenderingInfo info, int series, int catCount,
1058            double headH, double headW) {
1059
1060        Polygon polygon = new Polygon();
1061
1062        EntityCollection entities = null;
1063        if (info != null) {
1064            entities = info.getOwner().getEntityCollection();
1065        }
1066
1067        // plot the data...
1068        for (int cat = 0; cat < catCount; cat++) {
1069
1070            Number dataValue = getPlotValue(series, cat);
1071
1072            if (dataValue != null) {
1073                double value = dataValue.doubleValue();
1074
1075                if (value >= 0) { // draw the polygon series...
1076
1077                    // Finds our starting angle from the centre for this axis
1078
1079                    double angle = getStartAngle()
1080                        + (getDirection().getFactor() * cat * 360 / catCount);
1081
1082                    // The following angle calc will ensure there isn't a top
1083                    // vertical axis - this may be useful if you don't want any
1084                    // given criteria to 'appear' move important than the
1085                    // others..
1086                    //  + (getDirection().getFactor()
1087                    //        * (cat + 0.5) * 360 / catCount);
1088
1089                    // find the point at the appropriate distance end point
1090                    // along the axis/angle identified above and add it to the
1091                    // polygon
1092
1093                    Point2D point = getWebPoint(plotArea, angle,
1094                            value / this.maxValue);
1095                    polygon.addPoint((int) point.getX(), (int) point.getY());
1096
1097                    // put an elipse at the point being plotted..
1098
1099                    Paint paint = getSeriesPaint(series);
1100                    Paint outlinePaint = getSeriesOutlinePaint(series);
1101                    Stroke outlineStroke = getSeriesOutlineStroke(series);
1102
1103                    Ellipse2D head = new Ellipse2D.Double(point.getX()
1104                            - headW / 2, point.getY() - headH / 2, headW,
1105                            headH);
1106                    g2.setPaint(paint);
1107                    g2.fill(head);
1108                    g2.setStroke(outlineStroke);
1109                    g2.setPaint(outlinePaint);
1110                    g2.draw(head);
1111
1112                    if (entities != null) {
1113                        int row, col;
1114                        if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_ROW) {
1115                            row = series;
1116                            col = cat;
1117                        } else {
1118                            row = cat;
1119                            col = series;
1120                        }
1121                        String tip = null;
1122                        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getToolTipGenerator() != null) {
1123                            tip = this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getToolTipGenerator().generateToolTip(
1124                                    this.dataset, row, col);
1125                        }
1126
1127                        String url = null;
1128                        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getUrlGenerator() != null) {
1129                            url = this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getUrlGenerator().generateURL(this.dataset,
1130                                   row, col);
1131                        }
1132
1133                        Shape area = new Rectangle(
1134                                (int) (point.getX() - headW),
1135                                (int) (point.getY() - headH),
1136                                (int) (headW * 2), (int) (headH * 2));
1137                        CategoryItemEntity entity = new CategoryItemEntity(
1138                                area, tip, url, this.dataset,
1139                                this.dataset.getRowKey(row),
1140                                this.dataset.getColumnKey(col));
1141                        entities.add(entity);
1142                    }
1143
1144                }
1145            }
1146        }
1147        // Plot the polygon
1148
1149        Paint paint = getSeriesPaint(series);
1150        g2.setPaint(paint);
1151        g2.setStroke(getSeriesOutlineStroke(series));
1152        g2.draw(polygon);
1153
1154        // Lastly, fill the web polygon if this is required
1155
1156        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getWebFilled()) {
1157            g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
1158                    0.1f));
1159            g2.fill(polygon);
1160            g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
1161                    getForegroundAlpha()));
1162        }
1163    }
1164
1165    /**
1166     * Returns the value to be plotted at the intersection of the
1167     * series and the category.  This allows us to plot
1168     * {@code BY_ROW} or {@code BY_COLUMN} which basically is just
1169     * reversing the definition of the categories and data series being
1170     * plotted.
1171     *
1172     * @param series the series to be plotted.
1173     * @param cat the category within the series to be plotted.
1174     *
1175     * @return The value to be plotted (possibly {@code null}).
1176     *
1177     * @see #getDataExtractOrder()
1178     */
1179    protected Number getPlotValue(int series, int cat) {
1180        Number value = null;
1181        if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_ROW) {
1182            value = this.dataset.getValue(series, cat);
1183        } else if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_COLUMN) {
1184            value = this.dataset.getValue(cat, series);
1185        }
1186        return value;
1187    }
1188
1189    /**
1190     * Draws the label for one axis.
1191     *
1192     * @param g2  the graphics device.
1193     * @param plotArea  the plot area
1194     * @param value  the value of the label (ignored).
1195     * @param cat  the category (zero-based index).
1196     * @param startAngle  the starting angle.
1197     * @param extent  the extent of the arc.
1198     */
1199    protected void drawLabel(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D plotArea, double value,
1200                             int cat, double startAngle, double extent) {
1201        FontRenderContext frc = g2.getFontRenderContext();
1202
1203        String label;
1204        if (this.dataExtractOrder == TableOrder.BY_ROW) {
1205            // if series are in rows, then the categories are the column keys
1206            label = this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelGenerator().generateColumnLabel(this.dataset, cat);
1207        } else {
1208            // if series are in columns, then the categories are the row keys
1209            label = this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelGenerator().generateRowLabel(this.dataset, cat);
1210        }
1211
1212        Rectangle2D labelBounds = getLabelFont().getStringBounds(label, frc);
1213        LineMetrics lm = getLabelFont().getLineMetrics(label, frc);
1214        double ascent = lm.getAscent();
1215
1216        Point2D labelLocation = calculateLabelLocation(labelBounds, ascent,
1217                plotArea, startAngle);
1218
1219        Composite saveComposite = g2.getComposite();
1220
1221        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER, 1.0f));
1222        g2.setPaint(getLabelPaint());
1223        g2.setFont(getLabelFont());
1224        g2.drawString(label, (float) labelLocation.getX(),
1225                (float) labelLocation.getY());
1226        g2.setComposite(saveComposite);
1227    }
1228
1229    /**
1230     * Returns the location for a label
1231     *
1232     * @param labelBounds the label bounds.
1233     * @param ascent the ascent (height of font).
1234     * @param plotArea the plot area
1235     * @param startAngle the start angle for the pie series.
1236     *
1237     * @return The location for a label.
1238     */
1239    protected Point2D calculateLabelLocation(Rectangle2D labelBounds,
1240            double ascent, Rectangle2D plotArea, double startAngle) {
1241        Arc2D arc1 = new Arc2D.Double(plotArea, startAngle, 0, Arc2D.OPEN);
1242        Point2D point1 = arc1.getEndPoint();
1243
1244        double deltaX = -(point1.getX() - plotArea.getCenterX())
1245                        * this.axisLabelGap;
1246        double deltaY = -(point1.getY() - plotArea.getCenterY())
1247                        * this.axisLabelGap;
1248
1249        double labelX = point1.getX() - deltaX;
1250        double labelY = point1.getY() - deltaY;
1251
1252        if (labelX < plotArea.getCenterX()) {
1253            labelX -= labelBounds.getWidth();
1254        }
1255
1256        if (labelX == plotArea.getCenterX()) {
1257            labelX -= labelBounds.getWidth() / 2;
1258        }
1259
1260        if (labelY > plotArea.getCenterY()) {
1261            labelY += ascent;
1262        }
1263
1264        return new Point2D.Double(labelX, labelY);
1265    }
1266
1267    /**
1268     * Tests this plot for equality with an arbitrary object.
1269     *
1270     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
1271     *
1272     * @return A boolean.
1273     */
1274    @Override
1275    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1276        if (obj == this) {
1277            return true;
1278        }
1279        if (!(obj instanceof SpiderWebPlot)) {
1280            return false;
1281        }
1282        if (!super.equals(obj)) {
1283            return false;
1284        }
1285        SpiderWebPlot that = (SpiderWebPlot) obj;
1286        if (!this.dataExtractOrder.equals(that.dataExtractOrder)) {
1287            return false;
1288        }
1289        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getHeadPercent() != that.spiderWebPlotProduct.getHeadPercent()) {
1290            return false;
1291        }
1292        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct.getInteriorGap() != that.spiderWebPlotProduct.getInteriorGap()) {
1293            return false;
1294        }
1295        if (this.startAngle != that.startAngle) {
1296            return false;
1297        }
1298        if (!this.direction.equals(that.direction)) {
1299            return false;
1300        }
1301        if (this.maxValue != that.maxValue) {
1302            return false;
1303        }
1304        if (this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getWebFilled() != that.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getWebFilled()) {
1305            return false;
1306        }
1307        if (this.axisLabelGap != that.axisLabelGap) {
1308            return false;
1309        }
1310        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.axisLinePaint, that.axisLinePaint)) {
1311            return false;
1312        }
1313        if (!this.axisLineStroke.equals(that.axisLineStroke)) {
1314            return false;
1315        }
1316        if (!ShapeUtils.equal(this.legendItemShape, that.legendItemShape)) {
1317            return false;
1318        }
1319        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.seriesPaints, that.seriesPaints)) {
1320            return false;
1321        }
1322        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.defaultSeriesPaint, that.defaultSeriesPaint)) {
1323            return false;
1324        }
1325        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.seriesOutlinePaints, that.seriesOutlinePaints)) {
1326            return false;
1327        }
1328        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint,
1329                that.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint)) {
1330            return false;
1331        }
1332
1333        if (!this.seriesOutlineStrokes.equals(that.seriesOutlineStrokes)) {
1334            return false;
1335        }
1336        if (!this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke.equals(that.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke)) {
1337            return false;
1338        }
1339        if (!this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelFont().equals(that.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelFont())) {
1340            return false;
1341        }
1342        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.labelPaint, that.labelPaint)) {
1343            return false;
1344        }
1345        if (!this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelGenerator().equals(that.spiderWebPlotProduct3.getLabelGenerator())) {
1346            return false;
1347        }
1348        if (!Objects.equals(this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getToolTipGenerator(), that.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getToolTipGenerator())) {
1349            return false;
1350        }
1351        if (!Objects.equals(this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getUrlGenerator(), that.spiderWebPlotProduct2.getUrlGenerator())) {
1352            return false;
1353        }
1354        return true;
1355    }
1356
1357    /**
1358     * Returns a clone of this plot.
1359     *
1360     * @return A clone of this plot.
1361     *
1362     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if the plot cannot be cloned for
1363     *         any reason.
1364     */
1365    @Override
1366    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
1367        SpiderWebPlot clone = (SpiderWebPlot) super.clone();
1368                clone.spiderWebPlotProduct3 = (SpiderWebPlotProduct3) this.spiderWebPlotProduct3.clone();
1369                clone.spiderWebPlotProduct2 = (SpiderWebPlotProduct2) this.spiderWebPlotProduct2.clone();
1370                clone.spiderWebPlotProduct = (SpiderWebPlotProduct) this.spiderWebPlotProduct.clone();
1371        clone.legendItemShape = CloneUtils.clone(this.legendItemShape);
1372        clone.seriesPaints = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.seriesPaints);
1373        clone.seriesOutlinePaints = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.seriesOutlinePaints);
1374        clone.seriesOutlineStrokes = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.seriesOutlineStrokes);
1375        return clone;
1376    }
1377
1378    /**
1379     * Provides serialization support.
1380     *
1381     * @param stream  the output stream.
1382     *
1383     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1384     */
1385    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1386        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1387
1388        SerialUtils.writeShape(this.legendItemShape, stream);
1389        SerialUtils.writeMapOfPaint(this.seriesPaints, stream);
1390        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.defaultSeriesPaint, stream);
1391        SerialUtils.writeMapOfPaint(this.seriesOutlinePaints, stream);
1392        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint, stream);
1393        SerialUtils.writeMapOfStroke(this.seriesOutlineStrokes, stream);
1394        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke, stream);
1395        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.labelPaint, stream);
1396        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.axisLinePaint, stream);
1397        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.axisLineStroke, stream);
1398    }
1399
1400    /**
1401     * Provides serialization support.
1402     *
1403     * @param stream  the input stream.
1404     *
1405     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1406     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1407     */
1408    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream) throws IOException,
1409            ClassNotFoundException {
1410        stream.defaultReadObject();
1411
1412        this.legendItemShape = SerialUtils.readShape(stream);
1413        this.seriesPaints = SerialUtils.readMapOfPaint(stream);
1414        this.defaultSeriesPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1415        this.seriesOutlinePaints = SerialUtils.readMapOfPaint(stream);
1416        this.defaultSeriesOutlinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1417        this.seriesOutlineStrokes = SerialUtils.readMapOfStroke(stream);
1418        this.defaultSeriesOutlineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1419        this.labelPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1420        this.axisLinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
1421        this.axisLineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
1422        if (this.dataset != null) {
1423            this.dataset.addChangeListener(this);
1424        }
1425    }
1426
1427        /**
1428         * Applies the attributes of this theme to a  {@link SpiderWebPlot} .
1429         * @param regularFont
1430         * @param axisLabelPaint
1431         */
1432        public void applyToSpiderWebPlot(Font regularFont, Paint axisLabelPaint) {
1433                setLabelFont(regularFont);
1434                setLabelPaint(axisLabelPaint);
1435                setAxisLinePaint(axisLabelPaint);
1436        }
1437
1438}
